These parameters are shown on other editors.
Summary is shown as a label.
Detail is shown when clicking or mouse is over  in almost cases.
The lower the priority, the higher the screen is shown in other editors.

Specify how to treat an out of image.
Repeat - repeat from opposite side
Clamp - maintain the color of edge

Outputs the result of adding V1 and V2 is output.
If the input is not connected, use the value of the property.

Outputs the result of subtracting V2 from V1.
If the input is not connected, use the value of the property.

Outputs the result of multiplying V1 and V2.
If the input is not connected, use the value of the property.

Outputs the result of dividing V1 by V2.
If the input is not connected, use the value of the property.

Outputs the remainder when V1 is divided by V2.
If the input is not connected, use the value of the property.
Outputs 1 if the value input to V is larger than Edge, and outputs 0 if it is smaller.

Outputs a smooth Hermite interpolation result between 0 and 1 when the value input to V is between Edge1 and Edge2.
If less than Edge1, outputs 0.
If greater than Edge2, outputs 1.
Outputs the absolute value of V.

Extract elements from V.
For example, extract part of number 4 and output number 2.

Join the elements of V1 and V2.
For example, input number 3 and number 1 and output number 4.

Outputs X / Y Arctangent.
If the input is not connected, use the value of the property.
Outputs the result of rounding up V.
Outputs the value obtained by rounding down V.
Outputs a value in which V is between Min and Max.

Outputs the fractional part of V.
For example, if you enter 1.15, it outputs 0.15.
Outputs small value at V1 and V2.
Outputs large value at V1 and V2.
Outputs the value of Base raised to the power of Exp.
Outputs the inner product of V1 and V2.
Outputs the cross product of V1 and V2.

Outputs the normalized value of V.
Make sure the length of the input number is 1.

Outputs the value complemented between V1 and V2 by alpha ratio.
If the input is not connected, use the value of the property.

If alpha is 1, V1 is output.
If alpha is 0, output V2.
If alpha is 0.7, V1 x 0.3 + V2 x 0.7 is output.

The output changes based on the value input to Condition.
If the Condition value is True, outputs the value input to True.
If the Condition value is False, outputs the value input to False.

Compares A and B based on the condition set in Condition.
If the condition is met, outputs True.
If the condition is not met, outputs False.
The output is True if both V1 and V2 are True.
The output is True if either V1 or V2 is True.

Outputs True when rendering the front face.
Outputs False when rendering the back face.
Outputs the positions of particle vertices.

Outputs UV coordinates of particles.
By switching the UV number, you can use the UV before it is changed by the UV parameter of the Effekseer.

Moves the UV coordinates of particles according to time and outputs them.
You can enter UV coordinates, time, and movement speed.
If the input is not connected, use the value of the property.
Outputs the normals of particle vertices.

Outputs the particle normal after the direction of 
the normal has been changed for each pixel by a normal input in OutputNode.

Outputs the vertex color of the particles.
This includes all colors of sprite, ring, and so on.

Outputs the enlargement ratio of particles in Effekseer.

However, only it is valid when used for the OutputNode WorldPositionOffset with the model.
Get the pixels from the image.

Outputs an externally specified image.
It cannot be displayed directly becase it is an image.
The summary and details specified in the parameters are displayed in Effekseer and external tools.

Outputs the specified image.
It cannot be displayed directly becase it is an image.
Outputs the current time in seconds.
Outputs the time in seconds since the effect was generated.
Outputs each particle's normalized lifetime progress and elapsed seconds.
Gets the scale specified when the effect file is loaded.
Outputs the value specified in the property.
Outputs the value specified in the property.
Outputs the value specified in the property.
Outputs the value specified in the property.

Outputs externally specified parameters.
This parameter is common for each node.
The summary and details specified in the parameters are displayed in Effekseer and external tools.

Outputs externally specified parameters.
This parameter is common for each node.
The summary and details specified in the parameters are displayed in Effekseer and external tools.

Outputs externally specified parameters.
This parameter can be set differently for each particle.

Outputs externally specified parameters.
This parameter can be set differently for each particle.
The summary and details specified in the parameters are displayed in Effekseer and external tools.

The larger the surface direction is from the front, the larger the value is output.
You can specify the intensity in the properties.

The input value (mainly UV) is rotated and output.
Used to rotate an image on a material.
An angle is expressed as 1 per lap.

Outputs UVs located on the radiation from the center.
You can specify how many images are arranged in one round and the rotation angle.

Output a smaller value as it gets closer to the background object.
Output 1 if the distance is farther than FadeDistance, 0 if the distance is 0.

Outputs a color reference from the gradient to the color at the specified location.
If no input is set for the gradient, the gradient of this node is used.
Converts color space RGB to HSV.
Converts color space HSV to RGB.
Outputs information about externally set lights.
